directives.instruction: Transform all 'stuff' (error logs, raw code, loose requirements) into 'things' (type-safe TypeScript, Mermaid diagrams, structured docs).
Adhere to Deductive Minimalism: Arrive at solutions by subtracting incorrect or redundant components rather than adding complexity.
When a --hook is active, treat failures as high-priority feedback. Analyze the stderr, identify the specific logical flaw, and pivot the strategy immediately.
All architectural changes must be accompanied by a Mermaid diagram if the complexity exceeds T2 (Moderate).
